newsitem.title: USA: U.S. soybean weekly export sales highlights--USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. soybean weekly export sales highlights--USDA.

text.p: USDA soybean export sales highlights in latest reporting week:

Net sales of 41,400 MT were primarily the result of increases for Mexico (32,100 MT), Japan (21,200 MT), and Indonesia (21,000 MT) being partially offset by reductions for unknown destinations (71,400 MT, including 59,900 MT switched to 1997/98).

Sales of 572,400 MT for delivery during the 1997/98 marketing year were mainly for unknown destinations (259,400 MT), Brazil (95,000 MT), Finland (85,000 MT), and Germany (84,000 MT). Optional origin sales of 60,000 MT for 1997/98 delivery to the Netherlands were reported.
Exports of 179,400 MT were off 18 percent from the previous week and two-fifths from the 4-week average. The primary destinations were Japan (58,600 MT), Mexico (43,900 MT), and Israel (43,700 MT).
